verses.verse: Then Naomi<WH5281> her mother-in-law<WH2545> said<WH559> unto her, My daughter,<WH1323> shall I not<WH3808> seek<WH1245> rest<WH4494> for thee, that<WH834> it may be well<WH3190> with thee?

And now<WH6258> is not<WH3808> Boaz<WH1162> of our kindred,<WH4130> with<WH854> whose<WH834> maidens<WH5291> thou wast?<WH1961> Behold,<WH2009> he<WH1931> winnoweth<WH2219> barley<WH8184> tonight<WH3915> in<WH853> the threshingfloor.<WH1637>

Wash <WH7364> thyself therefore, and anoint<WH5480> thee, and put<WH7760> thy raiment<WH8071> upon<WH5921> thee, and get thee down<WH3381> to the floor:<WH1637> but make not thyself known<WH3045> <WH408> unto the man,<WH376> until<WH5704> he shall have done<WH3615> eating<WH398> and drinking.<WH8354>

And it shall be,<WH1961> when he lieth down,<WH7901> that thou shalt mark<WH3045> <WH853> the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> he shall lie,<WH7901> and thou shalt go in,<WH935> and uncover<WH1540> his feet,<WH4772> and lay thee down;<WH7901> and he<WH1931> will tell<WH5046> thee<WH853> what<WH834> thou shalt do.<WH6213>
And she said<WH559> unto<WH413> her, All<WH3605> that<WH834> thou sayest<WH559> unto<WH413> me I will do.<WH6213>
And she went down<WH3381> unto the floor,<WH1637> and did<WH6213> according to all<WH3605> that<WH834> her mother-in-law<WH2545> bade<WH6680> her.

And when Boaz<WH1162> had eaten<WH398> and drunk,<WH8354> and his heart<WH3820> was merry,<WH3190> he went<WH935> to lie down<WH7901> at the end<WH7097> of the heap of corn:<WH6194> and she came<WH935> softly,<WH3909> and uncovered<WH1540> his feet,<WH4772> and laid her down.<WH7901>
And it came to pass<WH1961> at midnight,<WH2677> <WH3915> that the man<WH376> was afraid,<WH2729> and turned himself:<WH3943> and, behold,<WH2009> a woman<WH802> lay<WH7901> at his feet.<WH4772>

And he said,<WH559> Who<WH4310> art thou?<WH859> And she answered,<WH559> I<WH595> am Ruth<WH7327> thine handmaid:<WH519> spread<WH6566> therefore thy skirt<WH3671> over<WH5921> thine handmaid;<WH519> for<WH3588> thou<WH859> art a near kinsman.<WH1350>

And he said,<WH559> Blessed<WH1288> be thou<WH859> of the LORD,<WH3068> my daughter:<WH1323> for thou hast showed more<WH3190> kindness<WH2617> in the latter end<WH314> than<WH4480> at the beginning,<WH7223> inasmuch as thou followedst<WH1980> <WH310> not<WH1115> young men,<WH970> whether<WH518> poor<WH1800> or<WH518> rich.<WH6223>

And now,<WH6258> my daughter,<WH1323> fear<WH3372> not;<WH408> I will do<WH6213> to thee all<WH3605> that<WH834> thou requirest:<WH559> for<WH3588> all<WH3605> the city<WH8179> of my people<WH5971> doth know<WH3045> that<WH3588> thou art a virtuous<WH2428> woman.<WH802>
And now<WH6258> <WH3588> it is true<WH551> that<WH3588> <WH518> I<WH595> am thy near kinsman:<WH1350> howbeit<WH1571> there is<WH3426> a kinsman<WH1350> nearer<WH7138> than<WH4480> I.

Tarry <WH3885> this night,<WH3915> and it shall be<WH1961> in the morning,<WH1242> that if<WH518> he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman,<WH1350> well;<WH2896> let him do the kinsman's part:<WH1350> but if<WH518> he will<WH2654> not<WH3808> do the part of a kinsman<WH1350> to thee, then will I<WH595> do the part of a kinsman<WH1350> to thee, as the LORD<WH3068> liveth:<WH2416> lie down<WH7901> until<WH5704> the morning.<WH1242>

And she lay<WH7901> at his feet<WH4772> until<WH5704> the morning:<WH1242> and she rose up<WH6965> before<WH2958> one<WH376> could know<WH5234> <WH853> another.<WH7453> And he said,<WH559> Let it not<WH408> be known<WH3045> that<WH3588> a woman<WH802> came<WH935> into the floor.<WH1637>

Also he said,<WH559> Bring<WH3051> the veil<WH4304> that<WH834> thou hast upon<WH5921> thee, and hold<WH270> it. And when she held<WH270> it, he measured<WH4058> six<WH8337> measures of barley,<WH8184> and laid<WH7896> it on<WH5921> her: and she went into<WH935> the city.<WH5892>

And when she came<WH935> to<WH413> her mother-in-law,<WH2545> she said,<WH559> Who<WH4310> art thou,<WH859> my daughter?<WH1323> And she told<WH5046> her<WH853> all<WH3605> that<WH834> the man<WH376> had done<WH6213> to her.

And she said,<WH559> These<WH428> six<WH8337> measures of barley<WH8184> gave<WH5414> he me; for<WH3588> he said<WH559> to<WH413> me, Go<WH935> not<WH408> empty<WH7387> unto<WH413> thy mother-in-law.<WH2545>

Then said<WH559> she, Sit still,<WH3427> my daughter,<WH1323> until<WH5704> <WH834> thou know<WH3045> how<WH349> the matter<WH1697> will fall:<WH5307> for<WH3588> the man<WH376> will not<WH3808> be in rest,<WH8252> until<WH3588> <WH518> he have finished<WH3615> the thing<WH1697> this day.<WH3117>
